page.title: 19BAKER'S HOLE
page.content: Baker's Hole is a dis-used quarry, consisting of 30.35 hectares. It is being filled in with industrial and domestic waste. It will take approximately 7 years to fill and a further 2 or 3 years to restore to a natural setting. The machines used on this project are: compactors; tracked loading shovels, and dumper trucks. It has cost half a million pounds for this machinery and Â£200,000 per annum for their fuel. In an effort to keep pests away, the area is sprayed, whilst birds of prey. Rats are controlled by poisoned baits put down by a contractor.To eliminate smells the dump has to be covered every day with at least 6 inches of sand & soil. The rubbish comes from Dartford, Gravesend, and Sevenoaks.
